clean_content:
Congenital / dysgenetic cysts

Definition / general

* By definition are intrapancreatic, do not communicate with duct system, lined by a single layer of cuboidal, columnar or flattened atrophic epithelium with a fibrous wall* Most congenital pancreatic cysts are multiple, almost all are associated with underlying congenital diseases that primarily affect other organ systems ([AJR Am J Roentgenol 2002;179:1375](12438020))* Often associated with polycystic disease affecting [kidney](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/kidneytumoradultpkd.html) and liver, [von Hippel-Lindau syndrome](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/kidneytumormalignantrccclear.html) or oral-facial-digital syndrome type I ([GeneReviews: Oral-Facial-Digital Syndrome Type I [Accessed 11 December 2017]](http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK1188/))* Single cysts may be due to abnormal duct development* Other syndromes: Elejalde syndrome ([eMedicine: Elejalde Syndrome [Accessed 11 December 2017]](http://emedicine.medscape.com/article/1069594-overview)), glutaric aciduria II ([NIH: Glutaric Acidemia Type II [Accessed 11 December 2017]](https://rarediseases.info.nih.gov/diseases/6523/glutaric-acidemia-type-ii)), Ivemark syndrome ([NORD: Ivemark Syndrome [Accessed 11 December 2017]](https://rarediseases.org/rare-diseases/ivemark-syndrome/)), Jeune syndrome ([NIH: Jeune Syndrome [Accessed 11 December 2017]](https://rarediseases.info.nih.gov/diseases/3049/jeune-syndrome)), Meckel-Gruber syndrome ([eMedicine: Meckel-Gruber Syndrome [Accessed 11 December 2017]](http://emedicine.medscape.com/article/946672-overview)), short rib polydactyly syndrome type 1 ([OMIM: Short Rib Thoracic Dysplasia 3 With or Without Polydactyly [Accessed 11 December 2017]](http://omim.org/entry/613091)), trisomy 13, 14, 15, [tuberous sclerosis](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/kidneytumorangiomyolipoma.html)

  
  
Case reports

* Multilocular cysts associated with choledochal cyst ([Hum Pathol 2003;34:99](12605374))

Congenital cyst

Cysts of cystic fibrosis

Definition / general

* See [cystic fibrosis](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreascysticfibrosis.html) topic

Dermoid cysts

Definition / general

* Seen in young patients (2nd - 3rd decade)

  
  
Case reports

* 64 year old man ([World J Surg Oncol 2007;5:85](17683548))

Tail of pancreas cyst

Epidermoid cysts

Definition / general

* May be present within an intrapancreatic spleen ([Pancreas 2011;40:956](21562442))* In tail, unilocular, typically contain concentric enzymatic concretions, may communicate with acinar system* Squamoid cyst of pancreatic ducts; has thin wall lined by transitional / squamous cells without keratinization or granular layer

  
  
Case reports

* 62 year old man with intrapancreatic spleen containing epidermoid cyst ([JOP 2011;12:279](21546709))

Foregut cysts attached to pancreas

Definition / general

* Rare; unilocular, smooth surface with clear mucoid material, ciliated epithelium resembles bronchogenic cyst but no respiratory glands, no cartilage and two smooth muscle layers ([Am J Surg Pathol 1996;20:476](8604815))

  
  
Case reports

* 34 year old woman with pancreatic mass ([JSLS 2008;12:183](18435895))* 37 year old woman with acute cholangitis ([JOP 2011;12:420](21737908))

Ciliated foregut cyst: FNA

Mesothelial cysts

Definition / general

* May be multiple and involve pancreas, liver, kidney or other abdominal structures

  
  
Case reports

* 36 year old man with 3 cm cyst ([Ann Diagn Pathol 2006;10:371](17126258))

Pancreatic hamartoma

Case reports

* Initial report in 20 month old girl with 9 cm cystic mass ([Hum Pathol 1992;23:1309](1427759))* 52 year old woman with 2.5 cm mass in pancreatic head ([J Korean Surg Soc 2012;83:330](23166894))* Well demarcated and composed of cystic ductal structures embedded in focally inflamed stromal tissue ([Am J Surg Pathol 2005;29:797](15897746))

  
  
Microscopic (histologic) images
  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreastruemicro5.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3491237/figure/F3/)

Various images

Nonepithelial cysts

Definition / general

* Includes endometrial cyst, lymphangioma, [pseudocysts](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreaspseudocyst.html), parasitic cyst

Pancreatic tissue derived cysts

Definition / general

* May appear in thorax or mediastinum, as components of gastroenteric duplication cysts, intralobar pulmonary sequestrations, teratomas or rarely from ectopic pancreatic tissue ([Mod Pathol 1996;9:210](8685216))* Paraduodenal wall cyst (cystic dystrophy): patients with paraduodenal (groove) pancreatitis, cysts may enlarge and adhere to duodenal wall, mimicking duodenal duplication; lined by granulation tissue, may be partly lined by ductal epithelium ([Semin Diagn Pathol 2004;21:247](16273943))

Tumors that are cystic

Definition / general

* Cystic tumors include [ductal adenocarcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasductal.html), [IOPN](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasiopn.html), [IPMN](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasipmn.html), [lymphoepithelial cyst](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreaslymphoepithelial.html), [mucinous cystic neoplasm](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmcn.html), [mucinous nonneoplastic cyst](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasmucnoncyst.html), [serous cystadenoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasserous.html), [solid papillary neoplasm](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreassolidpseudo.html)
